Description: Up for sale is a Lawsuit Era 6-String Electric Guitar. Made in Japan. The "Gibson" and serial number on the headstock are spoof. This is NOT a genuine Gibson guitar The guitar is in fair condition with wear. The back of the body has "buckle rash". The body is yellow with specks of glitter throughout. The fingerboard has wear. The guitar comes with a case but the case's hinges are broken and will be need to be replaced or fixed. Please contact me if you have any questions. TT (Shoe Tower) There are times when recycled materials are used for shipping. You may receive recycled packaging. This helps keep our prices low and helps the environment. I try to package all of our items in the same way I would like to receive my shipments, as safe as possible. Every item is described as accurately as possible, if you have questions, please ask before bidding. I offer hassle free returns on items that have been misrepresented, and I do make mistakes once in a while. Returns need to be within 14 days. Please contact me ASAP with any concerns. Since I do allow returns please do not open a case, I am more than happy to work with you. "For listings in which the seller has specified shipping costs for the item, the Best Offer price includes only the listed item. For listings in which the shipping costs aren't specified, the buyer can choose to include shipping costs in their offer." In keeping with the above eBay policy regarding the Best Offer feature, all Best Offer prices submitted by buyers will be processed by me as for the item only, never for the shipping costs. This will be the case regardless of whether a reduction of the shipping costs was entered as a "term" of the offer by the buyer. Shipping costs that are already specified by me and appearing in my listings are non-negotiable through the Best Offer feature. Any terms set by buyers for a reduction of shipping costs will simply not be honored. This is a policy eBay has created to protect sellers, given that we can now pre-fill our listings to automatically accept Best Offers at or over specific dollar amounts. When eBay automatically accepts the offer, it does not factor in or honor any written terms submitted by the buyer, but instead processes the submitted price as the item-only price. Hence the policy and my inability to honor such terms submitted by buyers through the Best Offer feature. Feel free to contact me with any questions you might have! Your item will ship as quickly as possible. Most of the time I am able to ship same-day or the next day. I ship business days via USPS and I use priority mail on most of my items.
